meanings.sent1: After sitting for a while, I needed to restretch my legs.
meanings.sent2: I decided to restretch the rubber band to its original length.
meanings.sent3: Trying to restretch a balloon animal can lead to funny shapes!
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like a rubber band that could restretch endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor encouraged us to restretch our bodies for better flexibility.

meanings.sent1: I had to restretch the rope to reach the other side of the room.
meanings.sent2: The athlete needed to restretch his muscles before the race.
meanings.sent3: He tried to restretch the chewing gum, but it snapped back comically.
meanings.sent4: The road seemed to restretch endlessly into the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to restretch the fabric to fit the new measurements.

meanings.definition: To make taut or tight again
meanings.sent1: She had to restretch the bedsheet to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to restretch the canvas before painting.
meanings.sent3: The elastic band refused to restretch, causing a comical mishap.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a rope that could restretch without breaking.
meanings.sent5: The trampoline needed to restretch its surface for safe bouncing.
